file_content.text: I'm going to the ark. When you're ready to leave Makeb, take the shuttle here at the camp. Good luck.
The ark's fuel rods, as promised. Toborro's gone--along with his entire supply of isotope-5.
The whole planet felt it. Lemda says the explosion triggered a chain reaction in the planet's core.
If you have unfinished business, better make it quick. I'll take the fuel rods and get our people to work installing them.
I left a shielded shuttle here at the camp. It's your ticket off Makeb. The rest of us are taking the ark.
You're sure there's nothing else that needs to be done? Have all the planet's refugees made it aboard the ark?
Do you need any more help?
The ship is full and ready to fly. Thanks to you, we're about to achieve the fastest planetary evacuation in galactic history.
We're in this together. If there's trouble, you'll need help. I'm sure the ark can seat a few extra people.
Let's all ride the ark.
The space is tighter than you can imagine. I appreciate the offer, but you've done more than enough for us.
This has been quite a vacation, but I think it's time to go home.
I'm leaving now.
And for us to find a new one.
I hope we meet again on Keylander Station.
If we don't get those fuel rods from Toborro, my people are doomed. Our fates rest with you.
The Cartel has deserted you, Toborro. You have no allies left--don't be a fool! Give us the fuel rods.
Never! The entire galaxy plots against me, but I still hold the ultimate power!
Let this planet tear itself apart! My fortress can withstand anything. When you are all dead, Toborro will still remain! This galaxy is mine!
Toborro, there's something very wrong with you. Listen to what you're saying--it doesn't make sense.
You need psychological help.
No more words! Now, only death!
I think you're overestimating your real estate, Toborro. When this planet goes, you're going with it.
Do you really want to die?
I am eternal! I am invincible!
We're done negotiating with that insane Hutt. Cut the comm and stop wasting time.
Switch off this crazy fool.
I thought I could appeal to the businessman in him. Apparently, that part of Toborro no longer exists.
That inbred imbecile has abandoned all sanity. You will have to take the ark's fuel rods by force.
His palace is a testament to my artistry. I poured my spirit into designing lethal defenses. I also left myself a private entrance inside.
Finding a way inside the palace is the least of our problems. We're heading into the heart of a lunatic's private playground.
That's good, but only a start.
A secret back door? I'm starting to like you, Oggurobb.
Sneaky little Hutt--I approve.
My charms are legion.
Destroying your creations is always a blast. Those droids look terrific engulfed in flames.
I enjoy trashing your work.
That is by design. Color! Vibrancy! Impact! Destruction should never be dull.
Toborro will have far more than my inspired designs guarding him. His most lethal soldiers and isotope-5 droids patrol every corridor.
We'll hold this position until you get back.
Without those fuel rods, millions will die. If you can't get them... I'm canceling your parade.
Tell your people not to worry. We'll get those fuel rods no matter what.
I'll return, I promise.
Be safe.
Parades are nice, but I'd rather have a kiss for luck before I go.
[Flirt] I like you, too.
I hate flying into certain death with dry lips. Help me out?
[Flirt] Kiss for luck, Lemda?
Why not....
You have people with blasters. Throw a few of them at Toborro for me.
No backup from your citizens?
My followers aren't soldiers. They'd only get in your way--and die.
You now have coordinates and the security code to my secret entrance. Once you're inside, contact me for more information. Don't die!
A shuttle will fly you to the mining platforms. We must shut down those drilling lasers before it's too late.
Doctor, it's such an honor. I'm so glad we weren't forced to kill you!
We held up our end of the bargain and got you to safety. Tell us about isotope-5--and how to fuel the ark.
We need information.
Don't make our guest any more nervous than he already is. The Republic only kills in self-defense.
That was never the plan.
As I saw on our flight from Sanctuary, you specialize in artful property damage.
The jury's still out on that. If he doesn't start being useful quick, he'll be a permanent resident.
Don't get his hopes up.
I am a living repository of boundless knowledge.
Now that you're here... what can you tell us about isotope-5? How does it fuel the ark?
Isotope-5... Toborro's great discovery at the center of Makeb. Something truly unique in all the galaxy--and worth destroying this planet to obtain.
Imagine a substance as light as shimmersilk but stronger than durasteel. It distorts gravity and electromagnetic fields so predictably that it can be refined into fuel.
Isotope-5 has limitless potential to remake this galaxy. Those droids you battled were first-generation prototypes. Playthings.
In Toborro's hands these weapons will oppress entire sectors. The Cartel will become as bad as the Empire--maybe worse.
Deadly toys for conquest.
More profitable than the Imperials, one would hope. Honestly, we don't know how they support themselves.
Isotope-5 is the Cartel's key to becoming a galactic superpower. That's why they invaded Makeb and why Toborro won't back down.
It all makes sense now.
He has staked the Cartel's entire future on this world. He cannot fail here.
If Toborro gets off Makeb with his droids and all the isotope-5, he'll topple the Republic and Empire both.
This is bad news for us.
Ah, good--you're following the logic. No need for me to elaborate.
With an isotope-5-powered army, Toborro could squash half the galaxy. No wonder he isn't giving up.
This is very, very bad.
And you have become the itch mite in his soup.
Are you saying there are even more advanced versions of those droids? How many? What are their capabilities?
Are there upgraded droids too?
Toborro has dozens of prototype weapons. Their capabilities vary based on whatever creative inspiration moved me that day.
Stop making excuses for your shoddy workmanship. I trashed your playthings, and I'll break anything else Toborro throws at me.
I broke them easily enough.
Sadly, I doubt you will encounter my more advanced designs.
I crafted a beautiful set of isotope-5 fuel rods to power Toborro's ark. Some of my finest work, but you'll never see it.
According to my datastream, Toborro has increased mining production to maximum levels. Makeb's destruction will arrive far ahead of schedule. You have a spacecraft, yes? We should depart immediately.
We're not leaving our people behind. If Toborro's drilling has accelerated Makeb's destruction, turning it off should slow it back down.
We'll shut down the mining.
We won't abandon millions of Makeb refugees. You said you could help us get the fuel rods back!
We only leave with the ark.
That was before I saw the latest updates on Toborro's drilling operations.
You never intended to help us. All you wanted was a way off Makeb before Toborro sent a hit squad after you.
You lying sack of filth.
No, no. I only became aware of the drilling increase during our voyage here.
The mining platforms are massive lasers drilling directly into the planet. Shutting them down would release core pressure and buy us time.
Attacking the mining platforms would be suicidal. Even worse, it might kill me. Wait... why do I get the feeling you're serious?
You just confirmed our next move. Stay put and hope we make it back.
We are seriously desperate.
Death by Toborro or slow suicide with the Republic. Perhaps I have chosen poorly.
What does Toborro have guarding these mining platforms?
Define "suicidal."
With a steady supply of raw isotope-5, my former employer can power a multitude of devices designed to exterminate all trespassers.
I don't trust this mound of flab as far as I can throw him. Stick him someplace secure--and small.
Someone lock up this Hutt.
An orbit-capable shuttle would do nicely. Joking.
We need to deactivate all of Toborro's mining platforms. That's the only way to slow Makeb's destruction until we can get the ark's fuel rods.
I fear it won't be as easy as flipping switches. The platforms and their control rooms will be heavily defended.
Everything on this planet has been an ordeal--I'd hate to break our perfect record. But don't worry, those drilling lasers are going offline.
I expect a challenge.
If they don't, I doubt we'll see each other again.
Surely Toborro has the platforms rigged to shoot down any incoming shuttles.
How will we get to them?
Thanks to Doctor Oggurobb's craft, we know what transponder frequency Toborro uses to identify "friendly" airspeeders. We'll fake them out.
When it comes to body count, Makeb's groundquakes have nothing on me.
I'll kill the defenders.
I suspect that's not an exaggeration.
I'll have a transport to the mining platforms prepped for you immediately. Keep us apprised of your progress.
Get to the Sanctuary research base and capture Doctor Oggurobb. Good luck.
Ah, you're here. Good news: Tarlam's refugees evacuated safely--and no fresh reports of Toborro's droids. You bought us time... and we'll need it.
This is Gez Addar, one of the Republic's top engineers and a brave man for coming down here.
Couldn't pass up a chance to thank the legendary Jedi who saved Coruscant. I was there when you stopped the Planet Prison.
I'm surprised you know anything about that. It wasn't common knowledge at the time.
That mission was top secret.
I heard about it well after the fact. Nothing like belatedly realizing you escaped certain doom.
Of all the Jedi, you're the one I've been most excited to meet. I'd love to pick your brain about holocron design.
Holocrons are more than merely technology. I'll happily discuss them with you--once we're all safely off Makeb.
Later, of course.
I'll need time to think up questions, anyway.
Major, it's an honor. I have a complete collection of Havoc Squad holovids. Your army's victory on Corellia? Amazing.
I'm just a soldier doing a job. Some jobs are bigger than others.
I was only doing my duty.
From what I hear, this job's your biggest yet. Evacuating a whole planet... incredible.
Captain, I was working at the Republic shipyards you saved from the Voidwolf. Any chance I can get your autograph--or a few hours to explore your ship?
I don't like people poking around my ship. Autographs are no problem.
I'll sign something, sure.
Fantastic. Here, you can scratch the screen on this datapad....
Never thought I'd get to meet one of the Republic's top ten most famous heroes. Somebody pinch me.
I'd rather just say hello.
This is the high point of my year. They called me crazy for volunteering to come down. Who's laughing now?
I can't tell you what an incredible honor it is to meet you all. They stream holovids of you constantly to the fleet.
There's a lot more to what we do than battling the Empire. My friends and I help people in need.
More than combat, I hope.
That's why I'm here. Can't let you take all that risk alone.
By risking your life to land on Makeb, you've shown great courage. Such acts inspire others.
We're all heroes here.
Think I'll wind up in a holovid, too? Give my parents something to show the neighbors? That'd be something.
Trust me, they edit those things to make us look good. We're just people fighting for the Republic.
Those vids are embellished.
Sure, and Coruscant's just a planet.
How often do you see my face, on average? I really need to get a talent agent collecting credits on these things....
I should be earning royalties.
You're the most legendary privateer in the galaxy. People should be paying you to dock at their stations.
I've been saying the same thing for years.
Have you verified Toborro's claim that the ark will only run on isotope-5?
Can you tell us about the ark?
I analyzed the ark schematics. Despite them being borderline incomprehensible, I can now say with authority that they reveal Toborro's threat is authentic.
I thought you were a scientist. Sounds more like you're running for the Senate.
Boy, you're a slick one.
I'm good with machines, but people are my real passion.
Gez just made it through the analysis of the ark schematics. I'm sad to report that Toborro wasn't lying.
The ark was specifically built to run on isotope-5. It's the only energy source capable of pushing that massive vessel through Makeb's atmosphere.
I still haven't heard a decent explanation for what that substance is. What makes isotope-5 so special?
Can you explain isotope-5?
It appears to be a radioactive variant of illerium unique to Makeb's planetary core. From what little I've examined, it's nearly a template element.
Isotope-5 can be modified into all manner of useful configurations, including a potent fuel source. But I'm no expert.
Those war droids Toborro sent to attack Tarlam also ran on isotope-5. Maybe we could convert their power cores into fuel?
Toborro's droids run on it.
You'd be acquiring it in such small amounts that we'd never get enough before Makeb's core goes critical.
That's it? You don't have a plan to fix it? What kind of engineer are you?
Some help you are.
We have to be realistic. Makeb's days are numbered, and dropping quickly. Isotope-5 is our only solution.
Then we need the real brains behind the Hutt Cartel's operations here: Doctor Juvard Illip Oggurobb. And we know where he is.
Whoa--the only five-time winner of the Bao-Dur Science Prize is on Makeb? Are you saying he designed the ark?
Probably those droids, too. Doctor Oggurobb has been holed up at the Sanctuary research complex since before his people invaded. If anyone knows about isotope-5, it's him.
Sounds like we're headed for Sanctuary. We need a full briefing, and quick. I can feel the ground shifting while we stand here.
Point me at him.
Why would a Hutt scientist help us at all? Isn't he with the Cartel?
This doctor is a Hutt, too?
Doctor Oggurobb is well respected across the galaxy. For a Hutt, he's pretty reasonable.
I've never met a Hutt who had a spine. I'll get this Doctor Oggurobb on our side--in pieces, if that's what it takes.
He'll talk, or die.
I doubt it'll come to that. Smart people know when to surrender.
The Sanctuary research complex is one of the most advanced experimental laboratories in the galaxy. It's on an isolated mesa completely under Hutt control.
There's no telling what sort of defenses a genius like Doctor Oggurobb has there, and you'll be going in blind.
There are data access terminals on Sanctuary's testing grounds. Try accessing one--it might let you disable any unwelcome surprises. Otherwise, good luck.
I don't care how well defended Sanctuary is--I'm tougher. I'll have Doctor Oggurobb back in time for dinner.
Time to kidnap a Hutt.
I have no plans to feed him. It would cost a fortune.
I promise to stay alive. You'll be worried sick the whole time I'm gone, won't you?
[Flirt] Will you miss me?
I've been worried sick since before you landed on Makeb.
Why can't we just go after Toborro? He's the one with the ark's fuel.
Are you sure about all this?
We're only getting one chance at this--we can't afford to be wrong about anything. Doctor Oggurobb has the knowledge we need.
And please, for the love of science--don't hurt Doctor Oggurobb. I didn't bring a way to preserve his brain.
